Reshape CI between wide/long formats

Source: R/reshape_ci.R
reshape_ci.Rd

Reshape CI between wide/long formats.

reshape_ci(x)

Arguments

x

A data.frame containing CI_low and CI_high.

Examples

library(bayestestR)

x <- data.frame(replicate(4, rnorm(100)))
x <- ci(x, ci = c(0.68, 0.89, 0.95))
reshape_ci(x)
#>   Parameter  CI_low_68 CI_high_68 CI_low_89 CI_high_89 CI_low_95 CI_high_95
#> 1        X1 -1.0147515   1.360947 -1.499165   2.057359 -1.652998   2.170620
#> 2        X2 -0.8520943   1.134661 -1.504062   1.832399 -1.702927   1.962836
#> 3        X3 -1.0674302   1.044977 -1.636316   1.748151 -1.973564   2.144929
#> 4        X4 -0.9424791   1.089103 -1.889010   1.623619 -2.058253   2.099978
reshape_ci(reshape_ci(x))
#>    Parameter CI     CI_low  CI_high
#> 1         X1 68 -1.0147515 1.360947
#> 2         X1 89 -1.4991652 2.057359
#> 3         X1 95 -1.6529980 2.170620
#> 4         X2 68 -0.8520943 1.134661
#> 5         X2 89 -1.5040622 1.832399
#> 6         X2 95 -1.7029267 1.962836
#> 7         X3 68 -1.0674302 1.044977
#> 8         X3 89 -1.6363164 1.748151
#> 9         X3 95 -1.9735643 2.144929
#> 10        X4 68 -0.9424791 1.089103
#> 11        X4 89 -1.8890100 1.623619
#> 12        X4 95 -2.0582530 2.099978

x <- data.frame(replicate(4, rnorm(100)))
x <- describe_posterior(x, ci = c(0.68, 0.89, 0.95))
reshape_ci(x)
#>   Parameter      Median CI_low_95 CI_high_95  CI_low_68 CI_high_68 CI_low_89
#> 1        X1 -0.02936115 -1.779354   1.802264 -0.8039913  1.0084946 -1.779354
#> 2        X2 -0.04016018 -1.937312   1.900625 -1.3577419  0.9893288 -1.937312
#> 3        X3  0.05042967 -2.056262   2.334875 -0.7714339  1.0650680 -2.056262
#> 4        X4  0.10265400 -1.919542   1.922422 -1.0427264  0.8949964 -1.234465
#>   CI_high_89   pd ROPE_CI ROPE_low ROPE_high ROPE_Percentage
#> 1   1.303599 0.52      89     -0.1       0.1      0.16666667
#> 2   1.566582 0.51      89     -0.1       0.1      0.06666667
#> 3   1.289457 0.53      89     -0.1       0.1      0.11111111
#> 4   1.922422 0.52      89     -0.1       0.1      0.02222222
reshape_ci(reshape_ci(x))
#>    Parameter      Median CI     CI_low   CI_high   pd ROPE_CI ROPE_low
#> 1         X1 -0.02936115 68 -0.8039913 1.0084946 0.52      89     -0.1
#> 2         X1 -0.02936115 89 -1.7793544 1.3035991 0.52      89     -0.1
#> 3         X1 -0.02936115 95 -1.7793544 1.8022637 0.52      89     -0.1
#> 4         X2 -0.04016018 68 -1.3577419 0.9893288 0.51      89     -0.1
#> 5         X2 -0.04016018 89 -1.9373119 1.5665817 0.51      89     -0.1
#> 6         X2 -0.04016018 95 -1.9373119 1.9006253 0.51      89     -0.1
#> 7         X3  0.05042967 68 -0.7714339 1.0650680 0.53      89     -0.1
#> 8         X3  0.05042967 89 -2.0562619 1.2894566 0.53      89     -0.1
#> 9         X3  0.05042967 95 -2.0562619 2.3348746 0.53      89     -0.1
#> 10        X4  0.10265400 68 -1.0427264 0.8949964 0.52      89     -0.1
#> 11        X4  0.10265400 89 -1.2344646 1.9224221 0.52      89     -0.1
#> 12        X4  0.10265400 95 -1.9195425 1.9224221 0.52      89     -0.1
#>    ROPE_high ROPE_Percentage
#> 1        0.1      0.16666667
#> 2        0.1      0.16666667
#> 3        0.1      0.16666667
#> 4        0.1      0.06666667
#> 5        0.1      0.06666667
#> 6        0.1      0.06666667
#> 7        0.1      0.11111111
#> 8        0.1      0.11111111
#> 9        0.1      0.11111111
#> 10       0.1      0.02222222
#> 11       0.1      0.02222222
#> 12       0.1      0.02222222
